Job Title: Executive Vice President, Mastercard Policy Center

Location: Washington, DC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
Our Purpose

We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.

Title And Summary

Executive Vice President, Mastercard Policy Center

Overview

Reporting to the Chief Legal and Global Affairs Officer, and as part of a team comprised of the Chief Legal Officer; EVP, Global Government Affairs; and VP, Global Affairs Operations (the “Global Affairs Leadership Team”), the leader of Mastercard Policy Center is responsible for identifying Mastercard’s global policy priorities. This Executive Vice President will lead a global team charged with understanding Mastercard’s corporate strategy as it relates to global policy trends, and developing policy solutions that enables this strategy. This is a global role, positioning Mastercard as a partner and thought leader to policy influencers worldwide. The EVP, Mastercard Policy Center will develop strong familiarity with and understanding of in Mastercard’s key markets, with significant travel expected.

Role

 Lead and coordinate a multidisciplinary team, fostering collaboration and synergy among members working on various aspects of global public policy strategies. Engage with think tanks, NGOs, academics and other policy influencers around the globe to develop deep subject matter expertise, identify trends, and create forward-looking policy solutions that advance Mastercard’s corporate strategy and vision for the future. Facilitate an ongoing strategic planning process with Mastercard’s strategy team, business teams and Legal and Global Affairs team in close and deep collaboration to refine, decide and communicate internally Mastercard’s policy goals and positions. Partner with Mastercard’s Government Affairs team to develop and plan strategic messaging for effective campaigns at the regional and local levels. Develop data-driven insights and empirical evidence to strengthen Mastercard’s policy analysis, advocacy and strategic positioning. This will include bringing together the work done across Legal & Global Affairs team and business units to curate, compile and analyze relevant data sources. Support Mastercard’s advocacy efforts with well-organized, accessible and up to date advocacy materials across relevant policy topics, and the preparation of responses to requests for comment and information. Provide periodic communications on geopolitical developments customized to Mastercard’s businesses, including broader geopolitical trends that will shape the business environment across major markets. Partner with the Global Affairs Leadership Team to support advocacy strategies that advance Mastercard’s corporate objectives. In collaboration with the VP, Global Affairs Operations, manage the Mastercard Policy Center’s budget: set targets, track expenses, and oversee external contracts with vendors. In collaboration with the VP, Global Affairs Operations, develop KPIs for measuring the team’s success and develop use of systems, process and technology to continually improve the team’s efficiency and enable more strategic work.


All About You

 Significant experience in policy development and advocacy, preferably in a leadership role within an international multicultural organization. Must exhibit a global mindset accompanied by significant global experience, ideally having worked in two or more of the following locations: Europe, the United States, South America, the Middle East, and the Asia Pacific region. Demonstrated ability as a skilled internal and external relationship builder, with the ability to construct and maintain strong networks of influence within the industry and governing institutions globally. Government advocacy and policy is a team sport! You must be a strong team player partnering closely with the Global Affairs Leadership Team and cross-functional leaders across Mastercard.


In the US, Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable_accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.

Corporate Security Responsibility

 All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:

Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;Report any suspected information security violation or breach, andComplete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.


In line with Mastercard’s total compensation philosophy and assuming that the job will be performed in the US, the successful candidate will be offered a competitive base salary based on location, experience and other qualifications for the role and may be eligible for an annual bonus or commissions depending on the role. Mastercard benefits for full time (and certain part time) employees generally include: insurance (including medical, prescription drug, dental, vision, disability, life insurance), flexible spending account and health savings account, paid leaves (including 16 weeks new parent leave, up to 20 paid days bereavement leave), 10 annual paid sick days, 10 or more annual paid vacation days based on level, 5 personal days, 10 annual paid U.S. observed holidays, 401k with a best-in-class company match, deferred compensation for eligible roles, fitness reimbursement or on-site fitness facilities, eligibility for tuition reimbursement, gender-inclusive benefits and many more.

Experience Level (if available): Director
